messages.message: anyone have experience with api calls in custom UDFs on a client's deployment that requires a proxy?

Hey @Charles , typically all the customers block any type of http traffic to leave their infrastructure.  To enable proxies, we need to set up a few environment variables on our app-tasks.  However, these get progressively difficult with different types of proxies.  For example, setting up for zscaler involves us setting up certificate on the pods.  Ntlm involves us setting up some password configuration and sidecars and so on.

@shaunak ok but the api calls technically are in the same infrastructure? I'm making api calls from a udf script (on their deployment), to run a flow and use some file service apis. Will that still need configuration?
If the api calls are in the same infrastructure, we don't need to worry about proxies.  Calls to file-service should ideally be using the ibfile Api.  Any reason we are not able to use those?
yeah....still trying to get to the bottom of it. Rules out the proxy issue then. Don't have direct access to customer env so live debugging is the only option...thanks for the help!
